narration: Welcome to this presentation on the human heart, a topic covered in your Class 7 CBSE curriculum.  We'll explore its structure and function.

title: Structure of the Heart
content:
Four Chambers: Two atria and two ventricles.
Valves: Control blood flow between chambers.
Blood Vessels: Carry blood to and from the heart.
image_desc:
A simplified diagram of the human heart showing the four chambers (left and right atria, left and right ventricles), the valves between them, and the major blood vessels connected to the heart (aorta, vena cava, pulmonary artery, and pulmonary veins).  Type: diagram

### Video Suggestion:
N/A
narration: Let's begin by looking at the heart's structure.  As you can see, it has four chambers: two upper chambers called atria and two lower chambers called ventricles.  Valves are crucial for ensuring blood flows in the correct direction.  Blood vessels transport blood throughout the body.

title: The Heart's Function: Circulation
content:
Pulmonary Circulation: Blood flow to and from the lungs.
Systemic Circulation: Blood flow to the rest of the body.
image_desc:
A diagram illustrating pulmonary and systemic circulation, showing the path of oxygenated and deoxygenated blood through the heart and lungs, and to the rest of the body. Type: diagram

### Video Suggestion:
N/A
narration: The heart's primary function is to pump blood throughout the body. This happens through two main circulatory pathways: pulmonary circulation, which involves the lungs, and systemic circulation, which supplies blood to the rest of the body.
